title: Loch Einich Walking Route

images.title: Nigel Brown / Loch Einich
images.caption: Loch Einich. A refreshing sight, and a more than refreshing wind blasting down the loch as the white horses testify.

images.title: Nigel Brown / The west side of Loch Einich
images.caption: The west side of the loch. Looking towards the spectacular rock ridges which fall from Sgor Gaoith and its satellites.

images.title: John Horner / Mountain biking in the Cairngorms.
images.caption: Mountain biking in the Cairngorms. A bike rests by the loch.

images.title: Nigel Brown / The east side of Gleann Einich
images.caption: The east side of Gleann Einich. This is probably the only sizeable bit of flat ground to the east of the track up Gleann Einich. Braeriach forms the backdrop.

images.title: Carn Eilrig by I A Smellie, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Carn Eilrig

images.title: Stuart Fisher / Path to Glen Einich in August
images.caption: A view of the lower path to Glen Einich with Heather in Bloom in August.

images.title: Angus / Upper Glen Einich
images.caption: Upper Glen Einich. View from Coire Dhondail looking down onto upper Glen Einich. Loch Mhic Ghille-chaoil is in the distance.

description: This tranquil loch is located in a remote place in the Cairngorms National Park. The loch can be reached by following a walking and cycling track south from the popular Loch an Eilein . It's about a 7.5 mile hike or ride from the loch through the beautiful Gleann Einich. The walk starts at the visitor centre and car park at Loch an Eilein. From here you can pick up trails heading south east into the Glen. The track passes along the rushing waters of the Am Beanaidh river which flows through the glen. Eventually you come out at the beautiful loch where you can enjoy a rest and take in the views before the return leg.
